       AN ACT to amend the labor law, in relation  to  requiring  employers  to
         provide  safety  ropes  and  system components to firefighters; and to
         repeal paragraph e of subdivision 1 of section 27-a of the  labor  law
         relating to the definition of system components

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph e of subdivision 1 of section 27-a of  the  labor
    2  law is REPEALED.
    3    S  2.  Subdivision  4  of section 27-a of the labor law, as amended by
    4  chapter 433 of the laws of 2007, is amended to read as follows:
    5    4. Safety and health standards. a.  The  commissioner  shall  by  rule
    6  adopt  all  safety  and  health  standards  promulgated under the United
    7  States Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 (Public  Law,  91-596)
    8  which  are  in effect on the effective date of this section, in order to
    9  provide reasonable and adequate protection  to  the  lives,  safety  and
   10  health  of  public  employees and shall promulgate and repeal such rules
   11  and regulations as may be necessary to conform to the  standards  estab-
   12  lished  pursuant to such act or pursuant to paragraph b of this subdivi-
   13  sion.
   14    b. Notwithstanding the provisions of paragraph a of this  subdivision,
   15  the commissioner, in consultation with the state occupational safety and
   16  health  hazard  abatement  board, shall promulgate rules and regulations
   17  recommended to him OR HER by such board which establish standards  when-

    1  ever  such  board  finds  (i)  that  no  federal standard exists for the
    2  particular condition being addressed and that such a standard is  neces-
    3  sary  for  the  protection  of  the  public employees at risk, or (ii) a
    4  federal  standard  exists,  but  conditions in public workplaces in this
    5  state require a different standard, and such state standard will  be  at
    6  least  as effective in providing safe and healthful places of employment
    7  as the federal standard.
    8    c. Except for an employer located in a city with a population of  over
    9  one million, any employer who employs a firefighter shall [provide safe-
   10  ty  ropes and system components for use by such firefighter] DEVELOP AND
   11  IMPLEMENT A WRITTEN SAFETY PROGRAM THAT INCLUDES BUT IS NOT  LIMITED  TO
   12  THE  FOLLOWING:  (1) A WRITTEN RISK ASSESSMENT TO DETERMINE THE PRESENCE
   13  OF FACTORS OR SITUATIONS IN FIRE SUPPRESSION THAT MIGHT PLACE FIREFIGHT-
   14  ERS AT RISK OF INJURY OR DEATH, (2) THE EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES  NECES-
   15  SARY  FOR  FIREFIGHTERS TO USE WHEN ENGAGED IN FIRE SUPPRESSION AT ABOVE
   16  GRADE FLOORS DURING A  STRUCTURE  FIRE  INCLUDING,  WITHOUT  LIMITATION,
   17  EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES FOR RAPID SAFE EGRESS.
   18    D.  The  commissioner  shall  [by  rule adopt the codes, standards and
   19  recommended practices promulgated by the most recent edition of National
   20  Fire Protection Association 1983, Standard on Fire Service  Life  Safety
   21  Rope  and  System Components, and] PROMULGATE SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS
   22  as are appropriate [to] FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF  WRIT-
   23  TEN  SAFETY PROGRAMS, WHICH SHALL INCLUDE, WITHOUT LIMITATION, AN EVALU-
   24  ATION OF the nature of the  risk  to  which  the  firefighter  shall  be
   25  exposed.  Such [safety ropes and system components] EQUIPMENT AND PROCE-
   26  DURES shall be, IN  THE  DETERMINATION  OF  THE  EMPLOYER,  adequate  to
   27  protect the health and safety of the firefighter.
   28    E. The employer shall ensure that the firefighter is instructed in the
   29  proper  use  of  the  [safety ropes and system components] EQUIPMENT AND
   30  PROCEDURES AT THE TIME OF THEIR INITIAL ASSIGNMENT AND  ANNUALLY  THERE-
   31  AFTER.  THE EMPLOYER SHALL ALSO ENSURE THAT:  (1) A FIREFIGHTER SHALL BE
   32  INFORMED  OF  THE  REQUIREMENTS  OF  THIS  SECTION,  THE  RISKS  OF FIRE
   33  SUPPRESSION AND THE LOCATION AND  AVAILABILITY  OF  THE  WRITTEN  SAFETY
   34  PROGRAM  UPON  REQUEST,  BY  THE  EMPLOYER OR THEIR DESIGNATED REPRESEN-
   35  TATIVES; AND (2) FIREFIGHTER TRAINING SHALL INCLUDE AT LEAST THE DETAILS
   36  OF THE WRITTEN SAFETY PROGRAM DEVELOPED BY THE EMPLOYER.
   37    F. In order to ensure the adequacy of the  [safety  ropes  and  system
   38  components]  EQUIPMENT  AND  PROCEDURES,  the  employer  must  routinely
   39  inspect and ensure that:
   40    (1) Existing [safety ropes and system components] EQUIPMENT AND PROCE-
   41  DURES meet the codes, standards and recommended practices adopted by the
   42  commissioner.
   43    (2) Existing [safety ropes and system components] EQUIPMENT AND PROCE-
   44  DURES still perform their function and to identify any of their  limita-
   45  tions such as but not limited to:
   46    (i) Checking the labels or stamps on the equipment; and
   47    (ii) Checking any documentation or equipment specifications; and
   48    (iii) Contacting the supplier or the [approval agency] MANUFACTURER;
   49    (3)  Firefighters are informed of the limitations of any [safety ropes
   50  and system components] EQUIPMENT AND PROCEDURES;
   51    (4) Firefighters are not allowed or required to use any [safety  ropes
   52  or system components] EQUIPMENT beyond their limitations;
   53    (5)  Existing  and  new [safety ropes and system components] EQUIPMENT
   54  have no visible defects that limit their safe use;
   55    (6) [Safety ropes and system components are] ANY  EQUIPMENT  IS  used,
   56  cleaned, maintained and stored according to manufacturer's instructions;

    1    (7)  The  firefighter is instructed in identifying to the employer any
    2  defects that the firefighter may find in [safety ropes and system compo-
    3  nents] ANY EQUIPMENT; and
    4    (8)  Any identified defects are corrected or immediate action is taken
    5  by the employer to eliminate the use of this equipment.
    6    [d.] G. Any person who may be adversely affected by a standard  issued
    7  under  this  section may, within thirty days after the effective date of
    8  such standard, commence a proceeding for  judicial  review  pursuant  to
    9  article seventy-eight of the civil practice law and rules.
   10    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   11  it  shall  have become a law except that the commissioner of labor shall
   12  promulgate regulations required under this act within one hundred twenty
   13  days of its effective date.
